node.title: Wellington Phoenix hope home fans aren't lost
node.description: After spending the last five months based in Australia the Wellington Phoenix return home this weekend.

node.title: Undocumented lotto winner struggles to claim prize in Belgium
node.description: An Algerian man who won €250,000 ($NZ400,000) on a €5 scratchcard in Belgium is struggling to claim his winnings because of his undocumented status.

node.title: Covid-19 update: 13,636 new cases in past two days, 30 more deaths
node.description: There have been 13,636 new community cases since the last Health Ministry update two days ago, with 30 further deaths reported.

node.title: Transmission Gully highway faces first holiday weekend test
node.description: Wellington's new Transmission Gully highway is proving popular over Easter.

node.title: House price index: Brakes go on housing market
node.description: A growing supply of homes, higher interest rates and tighter lending rules are contributing to a slow down in house price growth.

node.title: More people seeking help from charitable organisations
node.description: Charities are dealing with a surge in requests for help as pandemic pressures and increased housing costs begin to bite.

node.title: Less is Moore - why the Black Ferns still needed a change
node.description: Comment - Even before New Zealand Rugby's woeful Black Ferns culture review, Glen Moore's position as coach deserved to be put under scrutiny, writes Jamie Wall.

node.title: Secret council proposal to sell 10 reserves for housing revealed
node.description: Under the proposal, five reserves would be sold to Kāinga Ora, three to private developers, and two would become pensioner housing, documents obtained by Local Democracy Reporting suggest.

node.title: Sloppy builders may be contributing to building inspection delays
node.description: Building inspection wait times have shot up for many councils, with some scrambling to reduce them from seven weeks back to the usual three to five days.

node.title: BNZ customers left stranded by hours-long outages
node.description: BNZ said it was investigating a systems issue that affectrf online banking and some transactions.

node.title: Springfield to get new drinking water pipeline
node.description: A new drinking water pipeline has been confirmed for the Canterbury town of Springfield.

node.title: Australian MP forced to resign from senate over dual citizenship with New Zealand
node.description: West Australian Liberal Ben Small has been forced to resign from the Senate after becoming aware he is a dual citizen of New Zealand.

node.title: Blues hang on to beat Crusaders
node.description: The Blues have won in Christchurch for the first time in 18 years, defeating the Crusaders 27-23 in an enthralling Super Rugby Pacific match.

node.title: Twitter adopts 'poison pill' as challenger to Musk emerges
node.description: The possibility of a rival bid raises the spectre of more private equity firms vying for the microblogging and social networking service.

node.title: Joe Root steps down as England captain
node.description: Joe Root has stepped down as England's test captain, the country's cricket board said on Friday, succumbing to pressure from influential figures within the game following a run of poor results capped…

node.title: $100k to restore biodiversity after Canterbury flooding
node.description: More funding has been announced for parts of Banks Peninsula affected by severe flooding last December.

node.title: New Omicron subvariant found in Melbourne wastewater
node.description: A new Omicron subvariant has been detected in a Melbourne wastewater catchment - the first time it has been found in Australia.

node.title: Nurse fined, suspended for three months after forging signature
node.description: The nurse, who has permanent name suppression, is required to tell future employers about her misconduct.

node.title: Slavery-free chocolate won't leave bad taste in your mouth this Easter
node.description: Thousands of New Zealand kids will enjoy Easter egg hunts this weekend without knowing that many of those treats were produced by other children working in the most punishing conditions.

node.title: Over 150 Palestinians injured after Israeli police raid Al-Aqsa mosque
node.description: The Palestinian Foreign Ministry said it "holds Israel fully and directly responsible for this crime and its consequences".

node.title: "Extinct" wildflower rediscovered after 36 years
node.description: "We walked into [the forest] thinking it was going to break our heart," a scientist said, "and instead we ended up falling in love."

node.title: Police seek 18-year-old in connection with Auckland shooting
node.description: An 18-year-old is being sought in connection with an Auckland shooting last month.

node.title: Migrant arrivals at U.S. border soared to 221,000 in March, highest tally since 2000
node.description: he increase in border arrivals comes as the U.S. prepares to wind down the Title 42 pandemic-era rule, which allows authorities to swiftly expel migrants.

node.title: Health officials investigate mysterious increase in severe liver infection among kids
node.description: No deaths have been reported, the WHO said.

node.title: One dead in Dunedin house fire
node.description: Emergency services attended the fire in the suburb of Kensington shortly after 10pm.

node.title: Easter travelers hit with high airfare and staffing shortages
node.description: Domestic air ticket costs have increased 40% since January and are expected to rise another 10% by June.

node.title: Few NZ men take paid parental leave - would offering them more to stay home help?
node.description: Opinion - New Zealand's capped parental leave payments seem to reinforce the stereotype of women as carers and men as earners outside the home, Claire Breen writes.

node.title: J.D. Vance lands Trump's endorsement for Ohio Senate GOP race
node.description: Vance is facing a crowded field in the Republican primary, including former Ohio GOP chair Jane Timken, former Ohio State Treasurer Josh Mandel and businessman Mike Gibbons.

node.title: NHL players' union staff cleared of wrongdoing in Kyle Beach sex assault allegation
node.description: A law firm concluded miscommunication and misunderstanding were behind the lack of action after Beach reported being assaulted by Aldrich, a video coach.

node.title: Major retailers accused of profiteering from rising inflation
node.description: Watchdog group Accountable.US notes that the nation's top 10 retailers have recently generated $99 billion in profit.
